   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: 
   26: -export([borderline/1, atomic/1,
   27:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   28:          zip_to_binary/1,
   29:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   30:          zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   31: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   32:          compress_control/1,
   33: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   34:          explicit_file_info/1, mode/1,
   35:          zip64_central_headers/1, unzip64_central_headers/1,
   36:          zip64_central_directory/1,
   37:          basic_timestamp/1, extended_timestamp/1,
   38:          uid_gid/1]).
   39: 
   40: -import(proplists,[get_value/2, get_value/3]).
   41: 
   42: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   43: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   44: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   45: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   46: 
   47: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   48: 
   49: all() -> 
   50:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   51:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   52:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases,
   53:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   54:      unzip_traversal_exploit, fd_leak, unicode, test_zip_dir,
   55:      explicit_file_info, {group, zip_group}, {group, zip64_group}].
   56: 
   57: groups() -> 
   58:     zip_groups().
   59: 
   60: %% zip   - Use zip unix tools
   61: %% ezip  - Use erlang zip on disk
   62: %% emzip - Use erlang zip in memory
   63: -define(ZIP_MODES,[zip, ezip, emzip]).
   64: -define(UNZIP_MODES,[unzip, unezip, unemzip]).
   65: 
   66: zip_groups() ->
   67: 
   68:     ZipGroup=
   69:         [{zip_group,[],[{group,ZipMode} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   70:         [{ZipMode, [], [{group,UnZipMode} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   71:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   72:         [{G, [parallel], zip_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   73: 
   74:     Zip64Group = [{zip64_group,[],[{group,z64(ZipMode)} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   75:         [{z64(ZipMode), [sequence], [zip64_central_headers]++
   76:               [{group,z64(UnZipMode)} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   77:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   78:         [{z64(G), [], zip64_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   79: 
   80:     ZipGroup ++ Zip64Group.
   81: 
   82: z64(Mode) when is_atom(Mode) ->
   83:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([z64_,Mode]));
   84: z64(Modes) when is_list(Modes) ->
   85:     [z64(M) || M <- Modes].
   86: 
   87: noz64(Z64Mode) ->
   88:     case string:split(atom_to_list(Z64Mode), "_") of
   89:         ["z64",Mode] ->
   90:             list_to_atom(Mode);
   91:         [_Mode] ->
   92:             Z64Mode
   93:     end.
   94: 
   95: zip_testcases() ->
   96:     [mode, basic_timestamp, extended_timestamp, uid_gid].
   97: 
   98: zip64_testcases() ->
   99:     [unzip64_central_headers,
  100:      zip64_central_directory].
  101: 
  102: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  103:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  104:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  105:     [{started, Started} | Config].
  106: 
  107: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  108:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(get_value(started, Config))],
  109:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  110:     ok.
  111: 
  112: cleanup_priv_dir(Config) ->
  113:     %% Cleanup potential files in priv_dir
  114:     [ case file:delete(File) of
  115:         {error, eperm} -> file:del_dir_r(File);
  116:         _ -> ok
  117:     end || File <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(get_value(priv_dir,Config), "*"))].
  118: 
  119: init_per_group(zip64_group, Config) ->
  120:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  121: 
  122:     case {erlang:system_info(wordsize), disc_free(PrivDir), memsize()} of
  123:         {4, _, _} ->
  124:             {skip, "Zip64 tests only work on 64-bit systems"};
  125:         {8, error, _} ->
  126:             {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
  127:              "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
  128:         {8, N,M} when N >= 16 * (1 bsl 20), M >= 8 * (1 bsl 30) ->
  129:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  130:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [M div (1 bsl 20)]),
  131:             OneMB = <<0:(8 bsl 20)>>,
  132:             Large4GB = filename:join(PrivDir, "large.txt"),
  133:             ok = file:write_file(Large4GB, lists:duplicate(4 bsl 10, OneMB)),
  134:             Medium4MB = filename:join(PrivDir, "medium.txt"),
  135:             ok = file:write_file(Medium4MB, lists:duplicate(4, OneMB)),
  136: 
  137:             [{large, Large4GB},{medium,Medium4MB}|Config];
  138:         {8,N,M} ->
  139:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  140:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [M div (1 bsl 20)]),
  141:             {skip,"Less than 16 GByte free disk or less then 8 GB free mem"}
  142:     end;
  143: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
  144:     case lists:member(Group, ?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES ++ z64(?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES)) of
  145:         true ->
  146:             case get_value(zip, Config) of
  147:                 undefined ->
  148:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),Group),
  149:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  150:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{zip, noz64(Group)} | Config];
  151:                 _Zip ->
  152:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config),Group),
  153:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  154:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{unzip, noz64(Group)} | Config]
  155:             end;
  156:         false ->
  157:             Config
  158:     end.
  159: 
  160: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  161:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  162:     Config.
  163: 
  164: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) ->
  165:     UsesZip = get_value(zip, Config) =:= zip orelse get_value(unzip, Config) =:= unzip,
  166:     HasZip = has_zip(),
  167:     ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [memsize() div (1 bsl 20)]),
  168:     if UsesZip andalso not HasZip ->
  169:             {skip, "No zip command found"};
  170:        true ->
  171:             PrivDir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config,get_value(priv_dir, Config)), TC),
  172:             ok = filelib:ensure_path(PrivDir),
  173:             [{pdir, PrivDir} | Config]
  174:     end.
  175: 
  176: 
  177: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  178:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  179:     Config.
  180: 
  181: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
  182: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
  183: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
  184: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  185:     RootDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  186:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
  187: 
  188:     Record = 512,
  189:     Block = 20 * Record,
  190: 
  191:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
  192:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
  193:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
  194:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
  195:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
  196: 
  197:     %% Clean up.
  198:     delete_files([TempDir]),
  199:     ok.
  200: 
  201: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
  202:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
  203:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
  204:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  205: 
  206:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  207:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  208:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  209:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
  210:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  211: 
  212:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  213:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
  214:           #zip_file{name = Name,
  215:                     info = Info,
  216:                     offset = 0,
  217:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  218:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  219:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  220: 
  221:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  222:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  223:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  224: 
  225: 
  226:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  227:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  228: 
  229:     ok.
  230: 
  231: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  232:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  233:         true ->
  234:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  235:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  236:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  237:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  238:         _ ->
  239:             ok
  240:     end.
  241: 
  242: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  243:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  244: 
  245: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  246:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  247:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  248: 
  249: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  250:     receive
  251:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  252:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  253:         {Port, eof} ->
  254:             Port ! {self(), close},
  255:             receive
  256:                 {Port, closed} ->
  257:                     true
  258:             end,
  259:             receive
  260:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  261:                     ok
  262:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  263:                     ok
  264:             end,
  265:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  266:     end.
  267: 
  268: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  269:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  270: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  271:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  272: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  273:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  274: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  275:     ok.
  276: 
  277: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  278:     unlink(Port),
  279:     exit(Port, die),
  280:     ct:fail(Reason).
  281: 
  282: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  283:     Cmd.
  284: %%     case os:type() of
  285: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  286: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  287: %%     end.
  288: 
  289: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  290: 
  291: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  292:     X = next_random(X0),
  293:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  294:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  295:         _ -> false
  296:     end;
  297: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  298:     true.
  299: 
  300: %% Generates a random byte list.
  301: 
  302: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  303:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  304: 
  305: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  306:     X = next_random(X0),
  307:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  308: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  309:     lists:reverse(Result).
  310: 
  311: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  312: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  313: 
  314: next_random(X) ->
  315:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  316: 
  317: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  318: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  319: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  320:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  321:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  322:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  323:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  324: 
  325:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  326: 
  327:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  328:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  329:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  330: 
  331:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  332: 
  333:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  334:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  335:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  336:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  337: 
  338:     %% Clean up.
  339:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  340: 
  341:     ok.
  342: 
  343: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  344: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  345: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  346:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  347:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  348:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  349:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  350: 
  351:     %% Create a zip archive
  352:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  353:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  354: 
  355:     %% Open archive
  356:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  357: 
  358:     %% List dir
  359:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  360: 
  361:     %% Get a file
  362:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  363:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  364:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  365:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  366:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  367: 
  368:     %% Get all files
  369:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  370:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  371:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  372: 
  373:     %% Close
  374:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  375: 
  376:     %% Clean up.
  377:     delete_files([Names]),
  378: 
  379:     ok.
  380: 
  381: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  382: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  383: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  384: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  385:     %% Create a zip archive
  386:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  387:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  388: 
  389:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  390:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  391: 
  392:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  393:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  394: 
  395:     %% Clean up.
  396:     delete_files([Zip]),
  397: 
  398:     ok.
  399: 
  400: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  401:     Self = self(),
  402:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  403:     receive
  404:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  405:             ZipSrv
  406:     end.
  407: 
  408: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  409:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  410:     receive
  411:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  412:             true
  413:     after 1000 ->
  414:             false
  415:     end.
  416: 
  417: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  418: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  419:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  420:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  421:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  422: 
  423:     %% create a temp directory
  424:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  425:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  426: 
  427:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  428: 
  429:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  430:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  431: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  432: 
  433:     %% Verify.
  434:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  435:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  436: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  437: 		  FList),
  438:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  439: 		  RetList),
  440: 
  441:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  442:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  443: 
  444:     FList2 = ["abc.txt","quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  445: 
  446:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  447:     {ok, RetList2} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories]),
  448: 
  449:     %% Verify.
  450:     true = (length(RetList2) =:= 4),
  451:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  452: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  453: 		  FList2),
  454:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> 1 = delete_files([F]) end,
  455: 		  RetList2),
  456: 
  457:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  458:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  459:     ok.
  460: 
  461: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  462: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  463:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  464:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  465:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  466: 
  467:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  468:     %% clash.txt
  469:     %% ../clash.txt
  470:     %% ../above.txt
  471:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  472: 
  473:     %% create a temp directory
  474:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  475:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  476:     
  477:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  478:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  479:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  480: 
  481:     %% unzip in SubDir
  482:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  483: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  484: 
  485:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  486: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  487:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  488:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  489: 
  490:     %% clean up
  491:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  492:     
  493:      %% create the temp directory again
  494:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  495: 
  496:     %% unzip in SubDir
  497:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  498: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  499: 
  500:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  501: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  502:    
  503:     %% clean up
  504:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  505:     ok.
  506: 
  507: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  508: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  509:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  510:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  511:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  512: 
  513:     %% create a temp directory
  514:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  515:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  516: 
  517:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  518: 
  519:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile, [{cwd, Subdir}]),
  520: 
  521:     %% Verify.
  522:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  523: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  524: 		  FList),
  525:     lists:foreach(fun(F)->
  526:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  527:                               true -> ok = file:del_dir(F);
  528:                               false -> ok = file:delete(F)
  529:                           end
  530:                   end,
  531: 		  lists:reverse(RetList)),
  532: 
  533:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  534:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  535:     ok.
  536: 
  537: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  538: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  539:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  540:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  541:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  542:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  543: 
  544:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  545:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  546: 
  547:     %% Create a zip archive
  548:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  549:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  550: 
  551:     %% Open archive
  552:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  553: 
  554:     %% List dir
  555:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  556: 
  557:     %% Get a file
  558:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  559:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  560:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  561: 
  562:     %% Get all files
  563:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  564:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  565:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  566: 
  567:     %% Close
  568:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  569: 
  570:     %% Clean up.
  571:     delete_files([Names]),
  572: 
  573:     ok.
  574: 
  575: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  576: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  577: 
  578:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  579:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  580: 
  581:     {ok,
  582:      ["abc.txt", "quotes/rain.txt", "empty/", "wikipedia.txt", "emptyFile" ]} =
  583:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[names_only]),
  584: 
  585:     {ok,
  586:      [#zip_comment{},
  587:       #zip_file{ name = "abc.txt" },
  588:       #zip_file{ name = "quotes/rain.txt" },
  589:       #zip_file{ name = "wikipedia.txt" },
  590:       #zip_file{ name = "emptyFile" }
  591:      ]} =  zip:list_dir(Archive,[skip_directories]),
  592: 
  593:     ok.
  594: 
  595: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  596: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  597:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  598: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  599:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  600:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  601: 
  602: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  603: char_seq(N, First) ->
  604:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  605: 
  606: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  607:     Result;
  608: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  609:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  610: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  611:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  612: 
  613: data_files() ->
  614:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  615:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  616:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  617:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  618:     create_files(Files),
  619:     Files.
  620: 
  621: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  622:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  623:     create_files(Rest);
  624: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  625:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  626:     create_files(Rest);
  627: create_files([]) ->
  628:     ok.
  629: 
  630: %% make_dirs([Dir|Rest], []) ->
  631: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  632: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Dir);
  633: %% make_dirs([Dir|Rest], Parent) ->
  634: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  635: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  636: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  637: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  638: %%     Dir.
  639: 
  640: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  641: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  642:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  643:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  644:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  645:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  646:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  647:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  648:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  649:                           {ok, O} = zip:zip_open(A, []),
  650:                           zip:zip_get("not_here", O)
  651:                   end,
  652:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  653:     ok.
  654: 
  655: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  656:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  657:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  658: 
  659: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  660:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  661: 
  662:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  663:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  664:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  665:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  666:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  667:     case What(Full) of
  668:         Expected ->
  669:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  670:         Other ->
  671:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  672:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  673:     end.
  674: 
  675: %% Test extracting to binary with memory option.
  676: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  677:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  678:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  679:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),
  680:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  681:     _ = file:make_dir(filename:join(DataDir, "empty")),
  682: 
  683:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  684:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  685: 
  686:     %% Unzip a zip file into a binary
  687:     {ok, FBList} = zip:unzip(Long, [memory]),
  688: 
  689:     %% Verify.
  690:     lists:foreach(fun({F,B}) ->
  691:                           Filename = filename:join(DataDir, F),
  692:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  693:                               true ->
  694:                                   <<>> = B,
  695:                                   {ok, #file_info{ type = directory}} =
  696:                                       file:read_file_info(Filename);
  697:                               false ->
  698:                                   {ok,B}=file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F))
  699:                           end
  700:                   end, FBList),
  701: 
  702:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  703:     {ok,[]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  704: 
  705:     ok.
  706: 
  707: %% Test compressing to binary with memory option.
  708: zip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  709:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  710:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  711:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "zip_to_binary"),
  712:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  713: 
  714:     file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  715:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  716:     ZipName = "t.zip",
  717:     FilePath = filename:join(DataDir, FileName),
  718:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(FilePath, FileName),
  719: 
  720:     %% Zip to a binary archive
  721:     {ok, {ZipName, ZipB}} = zip:zip(ZipName, [FileName], [memory]),
  722: 
  723:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  724:     {ok,[FileName]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  725: 
  726:     %% Zip to a file
  727:     {ok, ZipName} = zip:zip(ZipName, [FileName]),
  728: 
  729:     %% Verify.
  730:     {ok, ZipB} = file:read_file(ZipName),
  731:     {ok, FData} = file:read_file(FileName),
  732:     {ok, [{FileName, FData}]} = zip:unzip(ZipB, [memory]),
  733: 
  734:     %% Clean up.
  735:     delete_files([FileName, ZipName]),
  736: 
  737:     ok.

  739: %% Test using the aliases, extract/2, table/2 and create/3.
  740: aliases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  741:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  742:     Size = 100,
  743:     B = list_to_binary(random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  744:     %% create
  745:     {ok, {"z.zip", ZArchive}} = zip:create("z.zip", [{"b", B}], [memory]),
  746:     %% extract
  747:     {ok, [{"b", B}]} = zip:extract(ZArchive, [memory]),
  748:     %% table
  749:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = _}, #zip_file{name = "b",
  750:                                                info = FI,
  751:                                                comp_size = _,
  752:                                                offset = 0}]} =
  753:         zip:table(ZArchive),
  754:     Size = FI#file_info.size,
  755:

  760: %% Test extracting a zip archive from a binary.
  761: unzip_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  762:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  763:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  764:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  765:     Archive = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.zip"),
  766: 
  767:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  768:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"), Archive),
  769:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  770:     Quote = "quotes/rain.txt",
  771:     Wikipedia = "wikipedia.txt",
  772:     EmptyFile = "emptyFile",
  773:     EmptyDir = "empty/",
  774:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  775: 
  776:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary.
  777:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Archive),
  778:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,EmptyDir,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]} = zip:unzip(Bin),
  779: 
  780:     %% Verify.
  781:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  782:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  783:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  784: 
  785:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  786:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  787:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  788: 
  789:     %% Don't be in ExtractDir when we delete it
  790:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  791: 
  792:     %% Clean up.
  793:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, Archive, ExtractDir]),
  794: 
  795:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  796:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  797: 
  798:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary with skip_directories
  799:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]}
  800:         = zip:unzip(Bin, [skip_directories]),
  801: 
  802:     %% Verify.
  803:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  804:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  805:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  806: 
  807:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  808:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  809:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  810: 
  811:     %% Clean up.
  812:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, ExtractDir]),
  813: 
  814:     ok.
  815: 
  816: %% oac_files() ->
  817: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  818: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  819: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  820: %%     create_files(Files),
  821: %%     Files.
  822: 
  823: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  824: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  825: delete_files(List) ->
  826:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  827: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  828:     Cnt;
  829: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  830:     case file:delete(Item) of
  831:         ok ->
  832:             DelCnt = 1;
  833:         {error,eperm} ->
  834:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  835:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  836:             file:del_dir(Item);
  837:         {error,eacces} ->
  838:             %% We'll see about that!
  839:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  840:             case file:delete(Item) of
  841:                 ok ->
  842: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  843:                 {error,_} ->
  844:                     erlang:yield(),
  845:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  846:                     file:delete(Item),
  847:                     DelCnt = 1
  848:             end;
  849:         {error,_} ->
  850:             DelCnt = 0
  851:     end,
  852:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  853: 
  854: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  855: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  856:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  857:     Dir = "compress_control",
  858:     Files = [
  859:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  860:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  861:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  862:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  863:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  864:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  865:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  866:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  867:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  868:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  869:             ],
  870: 
  871:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  872: 			  Files,
  873: 			  [{compress, []}],
  874: 			  []),
  875: 
  876:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  877: 			  Files,
  878: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  879: 			  []),
  880: 
  881:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  882: 			  Files,
  883: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  884: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  885: 
  886:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  887: 			  Files,
  888: 			  [],
  889: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  890: 
  891:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  892: 			  Files,
  893: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  894: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  895: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  896: 
  897:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  898: 			  Files,
  899: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  900: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  901: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  902: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  903: 
  904:     ok.
  905: 
  906: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  907:     %% Cleanup
  908:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  909:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  910:     delete_files([Zip]),
  911:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  912: 
  913:     create_files(Files),
  914:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  915: 
  916:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  917:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:zip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  918:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  919:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  920:     ok = zip:zip_close(OpenZip),
  921: 
  922:     %% Cleanup
  923:     delete_files([Zip]),
  924:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  925: 
  926:     ok.
  927: 
  928: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  929:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  930:         case Kind of
  931:             dir ->
  932:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  933:             _   ->
  934:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:zip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  935:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  936:         end,
  937:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  938:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  939: 
  940:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  941:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  942:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  943:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  944:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  945:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  946:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  947:     end,
  948:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  949: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  950:     ok.
  951: 
  952: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  953:     false;
  954: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  955:     CompressOpt =
  956:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  957:             [] -> all;
  958:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  959:         end,
  960:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  961:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  962:     UncompressOpt =
  963:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  964:             [] -> Default;
  965:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  966:         end,
  967:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  968:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  969: 
  970: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  971:     case H of
  972:         all ->
  973:             extensions(T, H);
  974:         H when is_list(H) ->
  975:             extensions(T, H);
  976:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  977:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  978:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  979:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  980:         _ ->
  981:             extensions(T, Old)
  982:     end;
  983: extensions([], Old) ->
  984:     Old.
  985: 
  986: foldl(Config) ->
  987:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  988:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
  989: 
  990:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
  991:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
  992:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
  993:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  994:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
  995:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
  996:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
  997:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  998:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
  999: 	try
 1000: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
 1001: 	catch
 1002: 	    throw:FooBin ->
 1003: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
 1004: 	end,
 1005:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 1006:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1007: 
 1008:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
 1009:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
 1010:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
 1011: 
 1012:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1013:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1014: 
 1015:     ok.
 1016: 
 1017: fd_leak(Config) ->
 1018:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1019:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1020:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
 1021:     BadExtract = fun() ->
 1022:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
 1023:                          ok
 1024:                  end,
 1025:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
 1026: 
 1027:     BadCreate = fun() ->
 1028:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
 1029:                                                  ["none"]),
 1030:                         ok
 1031:                 end,
 1032:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
 1033: 
 1034:     ok.
 1035: 
 1036: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
 1037:     ok;
 1038: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
 1039:     try Bad() of
 1040:         ok ->
 1041:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
 1042:     catch
 1043:         C:R:Stk ->
 1044:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
 1045:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1046:     end.
 1047: 
 1048: unicode(Config) ->
 1049:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1050:         latin1 ->
 1051:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
 1052:         utf8 ->
 1053:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1054:             ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1055:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
 1056:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
 1057:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
 1058:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
 1059:             case has_zip() of
 1060:                 false ->
 1061:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
 1062:                 true ->
 1063:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
 1064:                         true ->
 1065:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
 1066:                             ok;
 1067:                         false ->
 1068:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
 1069:                     end
 1070:             end
 1071:     end.
 1072: 
 1073: test_filename_compatibility() ->
 1074:     FancyName = "üñíĉòdë한",
 1075:     Archive = "test.zip",
 1076: 
 1077:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
 1078:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
 1079: 
 1080: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
 1081:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
 1082:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
 1083:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
 1084:     [begin
 1085:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
 1086:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
 1087:      end ||
 1088:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
 1089:     ok.
 1090: 
 1091: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1092:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1093:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1094:               [FileName, Comment]),
 1095:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1096:     {ok, Archive} =
 1097:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1098:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
 1099: 
 1100: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1101:     case test_zip1() of
 1102:         false ->
 1103:             ok;
 1104:         true ->
 1105:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1106:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1107:                       [FileName, Comment]),
 1108:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1109:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
 1110:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1111:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
 1112:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
 1113:     end.
 1114: 
 1115: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
 1116:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
 1117:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
 1118:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
 1119:     ok.
 1120: 
 1121: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
 1122:     case test_zip1() of
 1123:         false ->
 1124:             ok;
 1125:         true ->
 1126:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1127:             FileName = "a.txt",
 1128:             Comment = [Char],
 1129:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
 1130:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1131: 
 1132:             {ok, _} =
 1133:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1134:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
 1135:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
 1136:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
 1137: 
 1138:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
 1139:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1140:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
 1141:     end.
 1142: 
 1143: test_zip1() ->
 1144:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
 1145: 
 1146: has_zip() ->
 1147:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false.
 1148: 
 1149: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1150:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1151:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1152: 
 1153: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1154:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1155:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1156:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1157:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1158:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1159:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1160:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1161:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1162:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1163:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1164:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1165:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1166:     ok.
 1167: 
 1168: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1169:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1170:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1171:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1172:     Comment = [9999999],
 1173:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1174:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1175: 
 1176: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1177:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1178:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1179:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1180:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1181: 
 1182: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1183:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1184:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1185:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1186:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1187:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1188:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1189:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1190:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1191:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1192:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1193:             ok;
 1194:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1195:     end.
 1196: 
 1197: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1198:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1199:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1200:              receive
 1201:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1202:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1203:                               Reciver()
 1204:              end
 1205:      end)().
 1206:     
 1207: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1208:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1209:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1210:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1211:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1212:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1213:     ok.
 1214: 
 1215: mode(Config) ->
 1216: 
 1217:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1218:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1219:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1220: 
 1221:     Executable = filename:join(PrivDir,"exec"),
 1222:     file:write_file(Executable, "aaa"),
 1223:     {ok, ExecFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1224:     ok = file:write_file_info(Executable, ExecFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1225:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode }} = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1226: 
 1227:     Directory = filename:join(PrivDir,"dir"),
 1228:     ok = file:make_dir(Directory),
 1229:     {ok, DirFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1230:     ok = file:write_file_info(Directory, DirFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1231:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode }} = file:read_file_info(Directory),
 1232: 
 1233:     ?assertMatch(
 1234:        {ok, Archive},
 1235:        zip(Config, Archive, "-r", ["dir","exec"], [{cwd, PrivDir},{extra,[extended_timestamp]}])),
 1236: 
 1237:     OrigExecMode777 = OrigExecMode band 8#777,
 1238:     OrigDirMode777 = OrigDirMode band 8#777,
 1239: 
 1240:     ?assertMatch(
 1241:        {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1242:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode777 }},
 1243:              #zip_file{ name = "exec", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode777 }} ]},
 1244:        zip:list_dir(Archive)),
 1245: 
 1246:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1247:     ?assertMatch(
 1248:        {ok, ["dir/","exec"]}, unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1249: 
 1250:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1251:         true ->
 1252:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = ExecMode }} =
 1253:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"exec")),
 1254:             ?assertEqual(ExecMode band 8#777, OrigExecMode777),
 1255: 
 1256:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = DirMode }} =
 1257:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir")),
 1258:             ?assertEqual(DirMode band 8#777, OrigDirMode777);
 1259:         false ->
 1260:             %% emzip does not support mode
 1261:             ok
 1262:     end,
 1263: 
 1264:     ok.
 1265: 
 1266: %% Test that zip64 local and central headers are respected when unzipping.
 1267: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1268: %%  * compressed size
 1269: %%  * uncompressed size
 1270: %%  * relative offset
 1271: %%  * starting disk
 1272: %%
 1273: %% As we do not support using multiple disks, we do not test starting disks
 1274: zip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1275: 
 1276:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1277:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../archive.zip"),
 1278: 
 1279:     %% Check that ../../large.txt exists and is of correct size
 1280:     {ok, #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } } =
 1281:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt")),
 1282: 
 1283:     %% We very carefully create an archive that should contain all
 1284:     %% different header combinations.
 1285:     %% - uncomp.txt: uncomp size > 4GB
 1286:     %% - uncomp.comp.zip: uncomp and comp size > 4GB
 1287:     %% - offset.txt: offset > 4GB
 1288:     %% - uncomp.offset.txt: uncomp size and offset > 4GB
 1289:     %% - uncomp.comp.offset.zip: uncomp and comp size and offset > 4GB
 1290:     %%
 1291:     %% The archive will be roughly 8 GBs large
 1292: 
 1293:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1294:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.txt")),
 1295:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1296:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.zip")),
 1297:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../medium.txt"),
 1298:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "offset.txt")),
 1299:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1300:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.offset.txt")),
 1301:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1302:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.offset.zip")),
 1303:     ?assertMatch(
 1304:        {ok, Archive},
 1305:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1",
 1306:            ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip","offset.txt",
 1307:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"],
 1308:            [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1309: 
 1310:     %% Check that list archive works
 1311:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1312:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.txt",
 1313:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1314:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.zip",
 1315:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1316:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1317:           #zip_file{ name = "offset.txt",
 1318:                      info = #file_info{ size = 4 bsl 20 } },
 1319:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.offset.txt",
 1320:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1321:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.offset.zip",
 1322:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1323:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } }
 1324:          ]} =
 1325:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1326:     ok.
 1327: 
 1328: unzip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1329: 
 1330:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1331:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1332:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../../archive.zip"),
 1333:     Large4GB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),"large.txt"),
 1334:     Medium4MB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config), "medium.txt"),
 1335: 
 1336:     %% Test that extraction of each file works
 1337:     lists:map(
 1338:       fun F({Name, Compare}) ->
 1339:               ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1340:               ?assertMatch(
 1341:                  {ok, [Name]},
 1342:                  unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,[Name]}])),
 1343:               cmp(Compare, filename:join(ExtractDir,Name)),
 1344:               file:del_dir_r(ExtractDir);
 1345:           F(Name) ->
 1346:               F({Name, Large4GB})
 1347:       end, ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip",{"offset.txt",Medium4MB},
 1348:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"]),
 1349: 
 1350:     ok.
 1351: 
 1352: %% Test that zip64 end of central directory are respected when unzipping.
 1353: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1354: %%   * total number of files > 2 bytes
 1355: %%   * size of central directory > 4 bytes (cannot test as it requires an archive with 8 million files)
 1356: %%   * offset of central directory > 4 bytes (implicitly tested when testing large relative location of header)
 1357: %%
 1358: %% Fields that we don't test as we don't support multiple disks
 1359: %%   * number of disk where end of central directory is > 2 bytes
 1360: %%   * number of disk to find central directory > 2 bytes
 1361: %%   * number central directory entries on this disk > 2 bytes
 1362: zip64_central_directory(Config) ->
 1363: 
 1364:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1365:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "files"),
 1366:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1367: 
 1368:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1369: 
 1370:     %% To test when total number of files > 65535, we create an archive with 66000 entries
 1371:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1372:     lists:foreach(
 1373:       fun(I) ->
 1374:               ok = file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, integer_to_list(I)++".txt"),<<0:8>>)
 1375:       end, lists:seq(0, 65600)),
 1376:     ?assertMatch(
 1377:        {ok, Archive},
 1378:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1 -r", ["files"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1379: 
 1380:     {ok, Files} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1381:     ?assertEqual(65603, length(Files)),
 1382: 
 1383:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1384:     ?assertMatch(
 1385:        {ok, ["files/1.txt","files/65599.txt"]},
 1386:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,["files/1.txt",
 1387:                                                              "files/65599.txt"]}])),
 1388:     cmp(filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/1.txt"),
 1389:         filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/65599.txt")),
 1390: 
 1391:     ok.
 1392: 
 1393: %% Test basic timestamps, the atime and mtime should be the original
 1394: %% mtime of the file
 1395: basic_timestamp(Config) ->
 1396:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1397:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1398:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1399:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1400: 
 1401:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1402:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1403:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1404: 
 1405:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1406:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1407: 
 1408:     %% Create an archive without extended timestamps
 1409:     ?assertMatch(
 1410:        {ok, Archive},
 1411:        zip(Config, Archive, "-X", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}, {extra, []}])),
 1412: 
 1413:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1414:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime }} ]} =
 1415:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1416: 
 1417:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1418:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1419:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1420: 
 1421:     %% Timestamp in archive is when entry was added to archive
 1422:     %% Need to add 2 to ZMtime as the dos time in zip archives
 1423:     %% are in precise.
 1424:     ?assert(calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(Mtime) =<
 1425:                 calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(ZMtime) + 1),
 1426: 
 1427:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1428:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1429: 
 1430:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1431:     ?assertMatch(
 1432:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1433:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1434: 
 1435:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1436:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1437:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1438:                              }} =
 1439:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1440: 
 1441: 
 1442:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1443: 
 1444:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1445:         true ->
 1446:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1447:             ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1448: 
 1449:             %% On windows the ctime and mtime are the same so
 1450:             %% we cannot compare them.
 1451:             [?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime) || os:type() =/= {win32,nt}];
 1452:         false ->
 1453:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1454:             ok
 1455:     end,
 1456: 
 1457:     ok.
 1458: 
 1459: %% Test extended timestamps, the atime and ctime in the archive are
 1460: %% the atime and ctime when the file is added to the archive.
 1461: extended_timestamp(Config) ->
 1462: 
 1463:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1464:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1465:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1466:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1467: 
 1468:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1469:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1470:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1471: 
 1472:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1473:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1474: 
 1475:     ?assertMatch(
 1476:        {ok, Archive},
 1477:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1478: 
 1479:     %% list_dir only reads the central directory header and thus only
 1480:     %% the mtime will be correct here
 1481:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1482:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime}} ]} =
 1483:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1484: 
 1485:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1486:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1487:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1488: 
 1489:     ?assertEqual(Mtime, ZMtime),
 1490: 
 1491:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1492:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1493: 
 1494:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1495:     ?assertMatch(
 1496:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1497:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1498: 
 1499:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1500:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1501:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1502:                              }} =
 1503:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1504: 
 1505:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1506: 
 1507:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1508:         true ->
 1509:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1510:             ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1511: 
 1512:             %% On windows the ctime and mtime are the same so
 1513:             %% we cannot compare them.
 1514:             [?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime) || os:type() =/= {win32,nt}];
 1515:         false ->
 1516:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1517:             ok
 1518:     end,
 1519: 
 1520:     ok.
 1521: 
 1522: uid_gid(Config) ->
 1523: 
 1524:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1525:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1526:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1527:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1528: 
 1529:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1530:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ gid = GID, uid = UID }} =
 1531:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1532: 
 1533:     ?assertMatch(
 1534:        {ok, Archive},
 1535:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1536: 
 1537:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1538:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ gid = ZGID, uid = ZUID }} ]} =
 1539:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[{extra, [uid_gid]}]),
 1540: 
 1541:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1542:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1543: 
 1544:     ?assertEqual(UID, ZUID),
 1545:     ?assertEqual(GID, ZGID),
 1546: 
 1547:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1548:     ?assertMatch(
 1549:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1550:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{extra,[uid_gid]}])),
 1551: 
 1552:     {ok,#file_info{ gid = ExZGID, uid = ExZUID }} =
 1553:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"testfile.txt")),
 1554: 
 1555:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1556:         true ->
 1557:             ?assertEqual(UID, ExZUID),
 1558:             ?assertEqual(GID, ExZGID);
 1559:         _ ->
 1560:             %% emzip does not support uid_gid
 1561:             ok
 1562:     end,
 1563: 
 1564:     ok.
 1565: 
 1566: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1567: %%% Generic zip interface
 1568: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1569: zip(Config, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1570:     zip(get_value(zip, Config),
 1571:         Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1572: zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1573:     cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1574:         "zip "++ZipOpts++" "++Archive++" "++lists:join($ ,Filelist)),
 1575:     {ok, Archive};
 1576: zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1577:     ct:log("Creating zip:zip(~p,~n~p,~n~p)",[Archive, Filelist, Opts]),
 1578:     zip:zip(Archive, Filelist, Opts);
 1579: zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1580:     ct:log("Creating emzip ~ts",[Archive]),
 1581:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts),
 1582:     %% Run in peer node so that memory issues don't crash test node
 1583:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["+MMscs","8096"] }),
 1584:     try
 1585:         erpc:call(
 1586:           Node,
 1587:           fun() ->
 1588:                   %% For this not to use a huge amount of memory we re-use
 1589:                   %% the binary for files that are the same size as those are the same file.
 1590:                   %% This cuts memory usage from ~16GB to ~4GB.
 1591: 
 1592:                   {Files,_Cache} =
 1593:                       lists:mapfoldl(
 1594:                         fun F(Fn, Cache) ->
 1595:                                 AbsFn = filename:join(Cwd, Fn),
 1596:                                 {ok, Fi} = file:read_file_info(AbsFn),
 1597:                                 CacheKey = {Fi#file_info.type, Fi#file_info.size},
 1598:                                 {SubDirFiles, NewCache} =
 1599:                                     if Fi#file_info.type == directory ->
 1600:                                             {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(AbsFn),
 1601:                                             lists:mapfoldl(F, Cache#{ CacheKey => <<>> },
 1602:                                                            [filename:join(Fn, DirFn) || DirFn <- Files]);
 1603:                                        Fi#file_info.type == regular ->
 1604:                                             {[],
 1605:                                              case maps:find(CacheKey, Cache) of
 1606:                                                  {ok, _} -> Cache;
 1607:                                                  error ->
 1608:                                                      {ok, Data} = read_file(
 1609:                                                                     file:open(AbsFn, [read, raw, binary]),
 1610:                                                                     Fi#file_info.size),
 1611:                                                      Cache#{ CacheKey => Data }
 1612:                                              end}
 1613:                                     end,
 1614:                                 {[{Fn, maps:get(CacheKey, NewCache), Fi}|SubDirFiles], NewCache}
 1615:                         end,  #{}, Filelist),
 1616:                   zip:zip(Archive, lists:flatten(Files), proplists:delete(cwd,Opts))
 1617:           end)
 1618:     after
 1619:         peer:stop(Peer)
 1620:     end.
 1621: 
 1622: 
 1623: %% Special read_file that works on windows on > 4 GB files
 1624: read_file({ok, D}, Size) ->
 1625:     Bin = iolist_to_binary(read_file(D, Size)),
 1626:     erlang:garbage_collect(), %% Do a GC to get rid of all intermediate binaries
 1627:     {ok, Bin};
 1628: read_file({error, _} = E, _Size) ->
 1629:     E;
 1630: read_file(eof = E, _Size) ->
 1631:     E;
 1632: read_file(D, 0) ->
 1633:     file:close(D),
 1634:     [];
 1635: read_file(D, Size) ->
 1636:     {ok, B} = file:read(D, min(1 bsl 30, Size)),
 1637:     [B | read_file(D, Size - byte_size(B))].
 1638: 
 1639: unzip(Config, Archive, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1640:     unzip(get_value(unzip, Config), Archive, Opts);
 1641: unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1642:     UidGid = [" -X " || lists:member(uid_gid, get_value(extra, Opts, []))],
 1643:     Files = lists:join($ , get_value(file_list, Opts, [])),
 1644:     Res = cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1645:               "unzip "++UidGid++" "++Archive++" "++Files),
 1646:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1647:            lists:flatmap(
 1648:              fun(Ln) ->
 1649:                      case re:run(Ln, ~B'\s+[a-z]+: ([^\s]+)', [{capture,all_but_first,list},unicode]) of
 1650:                          nomatch -> [];
 1651:                          {match,Match} -> Match
 1652:                      end
 1653:              end,string:split(Res,"\n",all)))};
 1654: unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1655:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1656:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, Opts),
 1657:     {ok, lists:sort([F -- Cwd || F <- Files])};
 1658: unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1659:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1660:     %% Run in peer node so that memory issues don't crash test node
 1661:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["+MMscs","8096"] }),
 1662:     try
 1663:       erpc:call(
 1664:         Node,
 1665:         fun() ->
 1666:                 {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory | Opts]),
 1667:                 {ok, lists:sort(
 1668:                        [begin
 1669:                             case lists:last(F) of
 1670:                                 $/ ->
 1671:                                     filelib:ensure_path(F);
 1672:                                 _ ->
 1673:                                     filelib:ensure_dir(F),
 1674:                                     file:write_file(F, B)
 1675:                             end,
 1676:                             F -- Cwd
 1677:                         end || {F, B} <- Files])}
 1678:         end)
 1679:     after
 1680:         peer:stop(Peer)
 1681:     end.
 1682: 
 1683: cmp(Source, Target) ->
 1684:     {ok, SrcInfo} = file:read_file_info(Source),
 1685:     {ok, TgtInfo} = file:read_file_info(Target),
 1686:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.size, TgtInfo#file_info.size),
 1687:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.mode, TgtInfo#file_info.mode),
 1688: 
 1689:     {ok, Src} = file:open(Source, [read, binary]),
 1690:     {ok, Tgt} = file:open(Target, [read, binary]),
 1691: 
 1692:     cmp(Src, Tgt, 0),
 1693: 
 1694:     file:close(Src),
 1695:     file:close(Tgt).
 1696: 
 1697: %% Check if first 100 MB are the same
 1698: cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos) when Pos < 100 bsl 20 ->
 1699: 
 1700:     case {file:read(Src, 20 bsl 20), file:read(Tgt, 20 bsl 20)} of
 1701:         {{ok, Data}, {ok, Data}} ->
 1702:             cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos + 20 bsl 20);
 1703:         {E, E} ->
 1704:             ok
 1705:     end;
 1706: cmp(_Src, _Tgt, _) ->
 1707:     ok.
 1708: 
 1709: cmd(Cmd) ->
 1710:     Res = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1711:     ct:log("Cmd: ~ts~nRes: ~ts~n",[Cmd, Res]),
 1712:     Res.
 1713: 
 1714: disc_free(Path) ->
 1715:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 1716: 
 1717:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 1718:     Partitions =
 1719:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 1720:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 1721: 
 1722:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 1723:     %% path first.
 1724:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 1725:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 1726:         [] -> error
 1727:     end.
 1728: 
 1729: memsize() ->
 1730:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1731:         undefined ->
 1732:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1733:             Tot;
 1734:         Available ->
 1735:             Available
 1736:     end.
